titles: Remarks upon a late disingenuous discourse, writ by one T.D. under the pretence de causa Dei, and of answering Mr. John Howe's letter and postscript of God's prescience, &c., affirming, as the Protestant docrine, that GOd doth by efficacious influence universally move and determine men to all their actions, even to those that are most wicked by a Protestant.
author: Marvell, Andrew, 1621-1678.
publisher: Printed, and are to be sold by Christopher Hussey ...,
notes: Attributed to A. Marvell. Cf. Wing; NUC pre-1956.
Reproduction of original in University of Texas Library.
keywords: Howe, John, 1630-1705. --  Reconcileableness of God's prescience of the sins of men.
Danson, Thomas, ca. 1624-1694. --  De causa Dei.
